rush.hour

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • rush.hour.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Saves the board structure. The is saved as both a list of board elements which can be queried and as a 2d character array containing the ids as given in the loaded text file.

      • getGoalTiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> getGoalTiles()
        Gets the goal tiles of the red car. These are the tiles in front of the Goal object tile. WARNING: only works for goals placed in the right or bottom wall.
        Returns:
        A list of tiles where the RedCar should be placed.

      • getBoardElement

        public BoardElement getBoardElement(char id)
        Gets a board element for the list of board elements by id
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the board element
        Returns:
        board element when found, otherwise returns null

      • move

        public void move(Car car,
                 int moveAmount)
          throws BoardElementClashException
        Moves a car with a certain amount of tiles.
        Parameters:
        car - The car object to move
        moveAmount - The amount of tiles to move
        Throws:
        BoardElementClashException - When a car is not able to move to a tile location, because the tile is already occupied

      • serializeBoard

        public char[][] serializeBoard()
        Converts a board to a character array. A character is the id of a board element.
        Returns:
        array of board id characters

      • deSerializeBoard

        public java.util.List<BoardElement> deSerializeBoard()
        Converts a board represented as a character array to a list of BoardElements.
        Returns:
        list of board elements

      • readInBoardFromFile

        private char[][] readInBoardFromFile(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Reads in a board from a text file.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the board file
        Returns:
        A hasmap containing the character used in the text file as key and a list of occupied tiles by the character as value.

      • determineOrientation

        private Car.Orientation determineOrientation(java.util.List<Tile> tiles)
        Determines the orientation of a board element by comparing the x-axis from two tiles.
        Parameters:
        tiles - A list of tiles
        Returns:
        The enum value of the orientation
